speaker: Doctor
text: Can you tell me more about this rash on your scalp and forehead, when did it first appear and have you noticed any other symptoms such as itching or redness? REQUEST TEST: Complete Blood Count.

speaker: Measurement
text: RESULTS: Complete_Blood_Count: WBC - Normal for age, Hemoglobin - Normal for age, Platelets - Normal for age.

speaker: Doctor
text: Have you recently traveled to any new places or been exposed to anyone with a similar rash? Can you also tell me if the rash is painful to the touch or if you've noticed any discharge or crusting on the affected areas? REQUEST TEST: Skin Swab Culture.

speaker: Measurement
text: RESULTS: Skin_Scraping: Microscopy - No signs of fungal infection, Culture - Negative for bacterial growth.

speaker: Doctor
text: Can you describe the rash in more detail, is it made up of small bumps, blisters, or patches, and have you noticed any changes in its appearance since it first started? Have you tried any treatments or applied any creams to the affected area that may have caused an allergic reaction? REQUEST TEST: Allergy Panel.

speaker: Measurement
text: RESULTS: NORMAL READINGS.

speaker: Doctor
text: So all the test results are coming back normal, that helps to rule out some possibilities. Can you tell me if the rash has been constant since it appeared or have you noticed it worsening or improving at any point, and have you experienced any fever or swollen lymph nodes in your neck or face? REQUEST TEST: Thyroid Function Test.

speaker: Doctor
text: It's interesting that all the test results are coming back normal, which suggests that this rash might not be caused by an infection or an allergic reaction. Can you tell me if you've noticed any triggers that make the rash worse, such as stress, certain foods, or exposure to sunlight? REQUEST TEST: Biopsy of affected skin area.

speaker: Doctor
text: So all the test results are coming back normal, which is helping to rule out some underlying conditions. speaker: Doctor
text: It's quite puzzling that all the test results are coming back normal, I'd like to ask, have you noticed any relationship between the rash and your hair care routine, such as using a new shampoo or conditioner? Can you also tell me if you've experienced any skin conditions in the past, such as eczema or psoriasis? REQUEST TEST: Dermatology Consult.

speaker: Measurement
text: RESULTS: NORMAL READINGS.

speaker: Doctor
text: I'd like to ask, have you noticed any changes in your rash when you're in different environments, such as at work or at home, and do you use any hair products that contain harsh chemicals? REQUEST TEST: Patch Test for common allergens.

speaker: Measurement
text: RESULTS: NORMAL READINGS.

speaker: Doctor
text: I'm starting to think that this rash might be related to an external factor rather than an internal condition. Can you tell me if you've recently changed your laundry detergent or fabric softener, and do you wear any clothing or hats that could be irritating your scalp? REQUEST TEST: Hair and Scalp Examination under microscope.

speaker: Measurement
text: RESULTS: Inspection - Erythematous patches observed on the scalp, forehead, and along the hairline. Palpation - Some patches covered by greasy yellow scales. No significant tenderness noted on palpation.

speaker: Doctor
text: The presence of erythematous patches and greasy yellow scales is quite interesting. Can you tell me if you've noticed any flaking or shedding of the skin on your scalp, and have you been using any medicated shampoos or treatments that could be contributing to the greasiness? REQUEST TEST: Fungal culture of the scalp.

speaker: Measurement
text: RESULTS: Skin_Scraping: Microscopy - No signs of fungal infection, Culture - Negative for bacterial growth.

speaker: Doctor
text: I'd like to ask, have you noticed any improvement or worsening of the rash when you wash your hair or use certain hair products, and can you tell me more about your typical hair care routine, including how often you shampoo and what products you use? REQUEST TEST: Scalp pH level test.

speaker: Measurement
text: RESULTS: NORMAL READINGS.

speaker: Doctor

speaker: Doctor

Can you tell me if you've noticed any relationship between the rash and your personal care products, such as shampoo, conditioner, or soap, and have you recently changed any of these products? speaker: Measurement
text: RESULTS: NORMAL READINGS.

speaker: Doctor
text:
DIAGNOSIS READY: Seborrheic Dermatitis 

The majority of the doctors agree that the patient's symptoms, including erythematous patches and greasy yellow scales on the scalp, forehead, and along the hairline, are consistent with seborrheic dermatitis. Although the normal test results, including fungal cultures and autoimmune disorder panels, complicate this diagnosis, the doctors suggest that external factors such as hair care products or environmental conditions may be exacerbating the condition. The mention of Cholecystitis is not supported by the discussion, as it is a condition related to the gallbladder and does not match the symptoms or test results presented.
